48:59 Caption: This hugely entertaining encounter was a wonderful experience for every football lover to behold. The players did their utmost to make the game very enjoyable. There wasn't any evident superiority by either side today. The hosts displayed good teamplay with a lot of passes. The visiting side patiently waited in their own half to dispossess the opponent and hit them on the break.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The match between Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) and Basel at the Parc des Princes ended with an impressive 3-0 victory for the home side. The game was tightly contested in the first half, but PSG began to exert more control after the break, showcasing their superiority in an entertaining encounter.

### First Half:
The game kicked off with Basel initiating the proceedings. However, it didn't take long for the ball to go out of play, disrupting the flow in the early moments. Paris SG showed vigilance in their defense as they quickly resumed play with a throw-in. Efforts to press forward were halted as an offside was flagged against PSG at the two-minute mark, giving Basel an indirect free-kick.

The opening ten minutes were marked by a series of fouls and interruptions, as both teams struggled to find their rhythm. Basel had an opportunity to capitalize on a corner at the 4:44 mark, but their attempt went off target. Paris SG responded with a free-kick resulting from a Basel foul, yet chances remained sparse on both sides.

In the 11th minute, a pivotal moment saw Renato Steffen skillfully control a pass inside PSG’s box and unleash a shot, but the PSG keeper executed a stunning save. Seydou Doumbia was also close to breaking the deadlock for Basel, with his shot just grazing over the bar. This moment of near success for Basel served as a wake-up call for PSG.

PSG, in turn, mustered their offensive efforts. Adrien Rabiot nearly put them ahead with a powerful shot that narrowly missed the target. Angel Di Maria was particularly lively, his close-range efforts putting immense pressure on Basel’s defense. A vital breakthrough came in the 39th minute when Di Maria coolly finished off a killer pass, slotting the ball past Basel's goalkeeper to give PSG the lead. This goal clearly shifted the momentum in favor of the home side. The first half ended with PSG holding a slender 1-0 lead.

### Second Half:
The second half saw PSG taking the kick-off and continuing their attacking momentum. Edinson Cavani came tantalizingly close to increasing the lead early on when his header off a free-kick hit the post and rebounded away. Both teams showed grit and determination, but PSG's superior skill began to shine through.

The tempo of the game escalated further as fouls continued to break the play frequently. Basel’s Adama Traore received a warning after knocking down an opponent, and PSG were granted a free-kick which they failed to convert.

PSG’s dominance finally bore more fruits in the 57th minute when Lucas Moura capitalized on a rebound inside the box. His precise effort ensured that PSG extended their lead to 2-0. Despite Basel's efforts to come back into the game, their attempts were thwarted by PSG's robust defense. Substitutions were made by Basel to introduce fresh legs, with Andraz Sporar coming on for Seydou Doumbia and later Luca Zuffi for Matias Delgado. These changes, however, couldn’t turn the tide for the away team.

Serge Aurier received a yellow card for a rough tackle, adding to PSG's tally of fouls. Basel’s Renato Steffen also found himself in the referee's book for a hard challenge. During this spell, Basel managed to get a few shots off, the most notable being Marek Suchy's header that agonizingly hit the post.

Throughout this high-stakes game, PSG displayed an excellent showcase of teamwork and strategy. Their build-up play was smooth, and they often relied on sharp counter-attacks to expose Basel's defense. This tactical approach paid off handsomely as the clock ticked towards the final whistle.

In the closing moments, PSG were awarded a penalty when Michael Lang fouled in their box. Edinson Cavani took on the responsibility and confidently scored the spot-kick, sending the ball to the opposite side of the goalkeeper's dive, clinching a 3-0 victory for PSG. This goal solidified not only the win but also PSG's dominance throughout the match, showcasing their clinical finishing.

As the final whistle blew, PSG’s supporters celebrated a well-deserved victory. The game was indeed a captivating performance from start to finish, with PSG demonstrating their prowess and Basel putting up a resilient, albeit ultimately unsuccessful, fight. PSG’s tactical discipline, combined with individual brilliance, particularly from Di Maria and Cavani, who featured prominently in orchestrating this triumph, made it a memorable clash for spectators.

Overall, both teams exhibited moments of flair and determination. Paris SG's win was characterized by a blend of tactical astuteness, effective positioning, and superior execution in front of goal. Meanwhile, Basel, despite their tenacity and some near misses, lacked the finishing touch necessary to truly challenge the Parisians. The result keeps PSG in high spirits as they progress further, while Basel is left to reflect on missed opportunities and areas of improvement, hopeful for better displays in future fixtures.
